title: How BJP Brought Chandrababu Naidu, Nitish Kumar On Board For Waqf Bill

title: All you need to know about Pamban rail bridge
content: The 2,050-metre-long old Pamban sea bridge was built between 1911 and 1913. After it faced structural instability, a new railway sea bridge has been constructed near it. It has taken five years (2019-2024) to construct the new bridge, including an eight-month pause due to COVID-19.

title: 'Absolutely necessary': SC refuses to relax ban on firecrackers
content: Unless the court was satisfied that the pollution due to the "so-called" green crackers was bare minimum, there was no question of reconsidering the previous orders, the court observed.

content: The Zambia women's national team have removed their four U.S.-based players from the squad for the Yongchuan International Tournament in China due to concerns over U.S. travel measures, the Zambia FA said on Wednesday.

content: USWNT captain Lindsey Heaps hailed teammate Trinity Rodman in her return to international duty after an eight-month injury absence.

content: All eyes are on the Final Four, but college athletics officials are worried about suspicious bets on games featuring smaller schools.

title: Tsunoda's Red Bull promotion will define his F1 career
content: Yuki Tsunoda finally got his chance at Red Bull, but is being Max Verstappen's teammate a poisoned chalice?

title: Why is Russia missing from Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs list?
content: President Donald Trump announced broad tariffs affecting most nations, excluding Russia, citing existing sanctions that limit trade. Despite seeking enhanced trade relations with Russia, US trade figures with Russia have significantly declined, and experts question Trump's strategy given the larger commercial opportunities with Canada, Mexico, and Europe.

title: Waqf Bill: How numbers stack up in Rajya Sabha
content: The Rajya Sabha debates the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2024, following its passage in the Lok Sabha. With the NDA holding a slight numerical advantage in the Upper House, the bill, if approved, will proceed to the President for final assent.

title: 'It's time govt develop a spine': Oppn rips into PM Modi over US tariff
content: Opposition leaders criticized Prime Minister Modi over the US's 27 percent tariff on Indian goods. Rahul Gandhi and other MPs warned of severe impacts on industries like automobiles and pharmaceuticals. They urged the government to respond strongly, highlighting the economic risks and questioning Modi's handling of US relations.

title: 'Seniors said focus on govt job instead': India's fastest man Gurindervir
content: Gurindervir Singh's journey from a small village in Punjab to becoming India's fastest man is inspiring. Despite facing adversities like health issues and financial struggles, his determination led him to break national records. With his father's motivation and relentless training, he aims for more success while highlighting the financial challenges faced by Indian athletes.

title: USCIS' 'plain and straight message' to H1-B, Green Card visa applicants: There are only two...
content: USCIS has updated its policy to recognize only two biological sexes, aligning with President Trump's 2025 executive order. This change affects all pending and future immigration benefit requests, determining sex based on the birth certificate issued at or closest to the time of birth.

title: Why Trump excluded India's pharma sector from reciprocal tariffs
content: The US has exempted Indian pharmaceuticals from tariffs amidst President Trump’s broad tariff imposition, recognizing their crucial role in global healthcare. This move reinforces India’s position as a key provider of affordable generic medicines. Leaders highlight the strategic importance of the bilateral trade relationship, with the exemption offering India a chance to enhance its pharmaceutical sector.

title: 'No party whip': BJD tells MPs to 'exercise conscience' on Waqf Bill
content: Biju Janata Dal emphasizes the importance of justice, harmony, and community rights regarding the Waqf Amendment Bill in Rajya Sabha. The party did not issue a whip, encouraging its members to vote according to their conscience despite announcing opposition to the bill.

title: 'Will bring amendment to nullify Waqf Bill': Mamata Banerjee
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee has rejected the Waqf Amendment Bill passed by the Lok Sabha, expressing determination to nullify it once the BJP is ousted. During a presser, she accused the BJP of attempting to divide the country with the bill, which passed with 288 votes in favor and 232 against.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman revealed that in its early days, employees were expected to continue working from home after dinner with their families. Hoffman's stance signifies a demanding culture deemed essential for startup success and believes it drives significant financial rewards for those who embrace it.

title: Meerut murder: Muskan breaks down on seeing lover in video call
content: A Meerut court extended the judicial custody of Muskan Rastogi and Sahil Shukla for another 14 days in connection with the murder of Muskan's husband, Saurabh Rajput. They appeared via video conferencing and were kept in separate barracks. Muskan and Sahil have admitted to the gruesome crime.

title: 'Brilliant student, was saving life': Father of IAF pilot who died in Gujarat crash
content: Indian Air Force pilot Flight Lieutenant Siddharth Yadav tragically died in a Jaguar fighter jet crash in Jamnagar, Gujarat. He was a brilliant student, engaged to be married, and from a family with a strong military background. The crash occurred during a night mission due to technical malfunction.

title: Trump tariff: $760 billion wiped from Apple, Google, Fb & others’ market cap
content: The technology sector experienced significant losses following substantial reciprocal tariffs imposed by US President Donald Trump. Notable companies like Apple, Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet, and Amazon saw massive declines in market value, with Apple hit the hardest due to heavy reliance on manufacturing in China, which now faces tariffs exceeding 50%.

title: 'Abandoned ideals of Balasaheb': Shinde slams Uddhav on Waqf Bill
content: Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde criticizes Uddhav Thackeray for opposing the Waqf Amendment Bill, accusing Thackeray of abandoning Hindutva. Shinde defends the bill's intent to reform Waqf property administration, while Thackeray condemns what he calls BJP's hypocrisy.

title: IPL: Gujarat Titans' Kagiso Rabada returns to South Africa
content: Gujarat Titans pacer Kagiso Rabada has returned to South Africa for personal reasons during the IPL 2025 season. Rabada played two matches, taking two wickets, before being replaced by Arshad Khan. The Titans, having secured Rabada for Rs 10.75 crore, will miss his presence but have other pace options. They face Sunrisers Hyderabad next.

title: Top 5 entertainment news
content: Today's top stories include celebrity controversies and reflections on career turns. Highlights feature Ridhi Dogra defending her cross-border collaboration with Fawad Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan dismissing Botox in favor of natural beauty. Also covered are Anupria Goenka's casting insights and Barkha Bisht's candid remarks on her past relationship.

title: Sai Sudharsan reveals Gujarat Titans' 'game-changer' in IPL 2025
content: Following Gujarat Titans' eight-wicket victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Sai Sudharsan commended Mohammed Siraj's match-winning three-wicket haul, calling him a "game-changer." Sudharsan praised Siraj's energy and attitude. He also expressed satisfaction with his own batting performance that contributed to the team's success, moving GT up the points table with two wins and one loss.

title: 'Can't accept judgment': Mamata on SC's teachers' appointment ruling
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressed discontent with the Supreme Court's ruling upholding the cancellation of 25,000 teacher and non-teaching staff appointments in government schools. The court found large-scale manipulation in the recruitment process, ordering a fresh recruitment drive while allowing non-tainted candidates to return to previous government positions.

title: 'Use Starlink as bargaining chip': AAP's 'song advice' on US tariffs
content: Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha proposed using Elon Musk's Starlink satellite internet as leverage to renegotiate tariffs imposed by the US. Trump's recent announcement included a 27% reciprocal tariff on India, citing unfair trade practices by India against the US.

title: 'Son ate my dad': Mother 'mortified' after toddler eats grandfather's ashes
content: A UK mother Natasha Emeny from Lincoln was shocked when her one-year-old son Koah consumed her father's ashes while she was briefly upstairs handling laundry. Koah, who had never shown interest in the urn before, accessed it and spread the ashes around. Despite the shocking incident, Natasha later found some humor in the situation, which attracted widespread attention.

title: '100 choohe kha kar billi Haj ko chali': Giriraj Singh slams Cong on Waqf Bill
content: Union minister Giriraj Singh sharply criticized Congress over the Waqf Amendment Bill, accusing the party of past appeasement. Singh highlighted how the BJP-led government rectified the mistakes from 2013. The Lok Sabha passed the bill after an extended debate, aiming to improve Waqf property administration.

title: Explained: The formula Trump used to decide reciprocal tariffs
content: President Donald Trump has announced a new tariff regime, imposing a 10% baseline tax on imports from all nations and higher levies on countries with a trade surplus with the US. This action, justified as correcting trade imbalances, has significantly affected India with a 26% tariff on all its exports, leading to a negative market reaction.

title: PCB chief takes charge as Asian Cricket Council president
content: Mohsin Naqvi, the new Asian Cricket Council president and current PCB chairman, aims to enhance Asian cricket's growth and influence. Succeeding Shammi Silva, Naqvi is committed to fostering collaboration and development. Silva, reflecting on his tenure, is confident in Naqvi's leadership to continue advancing the ACC's prominence and achievements in the cricketing world.

title: Pakistan cricketer mocks PCB, says 'if I become chairman ... '
content: Pakistan cricketer Saud Shakeel humorously criticized the PCB's instability in coaching appointments. Amid this chaos, Pakistan faced another defeat as New Zealand won by 84 runs, securing the series. New Zealand's Mitchell Hay scored an unbeaten 99, while Pakistan's Faheem Ashraf's 73 fell short. Pakistan now aims to avoid a whitewash in the final ODI.

title: 49kg gold, Rs 38.4 cr in hawala transfers: How K'taka jeweller helped Ranya
content: Jeweller Sahil Sakaria Jain is suspected of assisting actor Ranya Rao in selling 49kg of smuggled gold worth over Rs 40 crore. Jain also managed hawala transactions, transferring significant sums of money to Dubai, and was paid a commission for each transaction.

title: US prohibits its officials in China from dating Chinese citizens
content: The US government has implemented a ban on its personnel in China, including diplomats and their families, from engaging in romantic relationships with Chinese citizens. Initiated in January by former Ambassador Nicholas Burns, the policy aims to mitigate espionage risks and is enforced through immediate expulsion for any violations.

title: Judge to man: “You have no right to marry without an income” – Viral video sparks debate
content: We live in a time when conversations about marriage are evolving rapidly, and a recent viral courtroom video is at the center of a heated debate: Is financial stability a must before you get married? The viral clip, featuring a judge grilling a man about his income (or lack of it), has triggered a storm of opinions across social media.

title: RJ Mahvash says ‘I am very much single', amid dating rumours with Yuzvendra Chahal
content: RJ Mahvash clarified in a podcast that she is currently single and skeptical about the concept of marriage. Despite being linked with cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal recently, she expressed that she is focusing on her career and personal growth, keeping marriage-related decisions on hold.

title: 'It's not Rs 27 crore price tag that's affecting Rishabh Pant'
content: Rishabh Pant, after a remarkable IPL 2024 return post a serious car accident, is struggling in IPL 2025 with the Lucknow Super Giants. Despite high expectations and a record Rs 27 crore deal, Pant's batting form has been poor. Former player Piyush Chawla attributes his difficulties to form, not pressure, stressing his need for a game-changing innings.

title: Watch: Australia PM Albanese stumbles off stage while posing for photos
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese fell off a stage while posing for photos at a Mining and Energy Union conference in Lovedale. He assured the crowd he was unharmed. Earlier, climate activists disrupted his hospital visit. Despite recent setbacks, polling indicates increased support for Albanese, with him leading as the preferred prime minister ahead of the upcoming federal election.

title: Vitamin supplements one should never take: American doctor suggests alternatives
content: Dr. Jaban Moore, a functional medicine doctor, highlights the potential side effects of certain vitamin supplements. He advises against taking synthetic B12, magnesium oxide or citrate, and ferrous sulfate due to their adverse effects, and suggests natural alternatives for better absorption and overall health.

title: Punjab highway hoardings defy law, glorify rapist pastor Bajinder Singh
content: Life-size hoardings of rape-convicted preacher Bajinder Singh have been unlawfully placed along highways in Punjab's Mohali district, violating Supreme Court directives. This blatant breach of legal restrictions poses a significant traffic hazard, with local authorities failing to prevent the unauthorized displays.

title: Hungary announces ICC withdrawal as Israel's Netanyahu visits
content: Hungary on Thursday said it will quit the International Criminal Court, just as Prime Minister Viktor Orban hosted his Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu, whom the tribunal has accused of war crimes in Gaza. Netanyahu was invited last November, a day after the ICC issued an arrest warrant against the Israeli leader for crimes against humanity and war crimes.

title: New coal capacity hit 20-year low in 2024: report
content: The world added the smallest amount of new coal capacity in two decades last year, a report said Thursday, but use of the fossil fuel is still surging in China and India. Last year also saw a record number of new coal proposals in India, the report warned.

title: Wayne Gretzky's daughter turns heads in new pictures while father faces heat
content: Wayne Gretzky has faced criticism for allegedly supporting the opposing team at the 4 Nations Face Off’s final match, but his daughter Paulina Gretzky remains unaffected by sharing photos from a luxurious St. Barts trip. She posted stylish pictures with friends, while her family kept away from the controversy, which stemmed from Wayne not wearing the Canadian jersey.

title: Folk festivals in colleges help to revive traditional art forms: Mandya MLA
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! Karnataka Today Your download of top 5 technology stories of the day .

title: 100-year-old doctor shares 7 principles of good health and longevity
content: This 100-year-old doctor’s wisdom is backed by decades of research and personal experience. While modern medicine has advanced, the power of lifestyle choices remains unmatched. Adopting these principles can lead to a healthier, longer, and more fulfilling life.

title: UPSC NDA admit card 2025 released: Download your hall ticket
content: The UPSC has released the admit cards for the National Defence Academy & Naval Academy Examination (I), 2025, also known as NDA 1 2025, on April 3. The exam is scheduled for April 13, 2025. Candidates can download their hall tickets from the official UPSC website. The exam will be held in two sessions: Mathematics and the General Ability Test. Aspirants are required to bring their admit card and a valid photo ID for entry.

title: 18 hrs & counting: 265 flyers on London-Mumbai flight stuck in Turkey
content: Over 260 passengers of a Virgin Atlantic flight from London to Mumbai are stranded at Turkey's Diyarbakır Airport for over 18 hours. The flight had been diverted due to a medical emergency and later faced technical issues. Passengers are complaining about the lack of arrangements and inedible food while they await further information.

title: This is how Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs will roll out in India
content: US President Donald Trump announced extensive reciprocal tariff proposals, significantly affecting India with an extra 27% duty. The Commerce Department is assessing the impacts. Both nations aim to boost trade to $500 billion by 2030, with continuous negotiations for a bilateral trade agreement. The India-US relationship focuses on enhancing trade, investments, and technology transfers.

title: 'China took 4,000 km, we’re cutting cake,' says Rahul; BJP takes 'soup' jibe
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the BJP for its handling of the India-China border issue and US tariffs, accusing them of submission to foreign interests. He claimed China is occupying 4,000 sq km of Indian territory and urged for status quo restoration. Gandhi also expressed concern over the Foreign Secretary's interaction with the Chinese envoy.

title: MNS activists confront bank manager in Thane for not conversing in Marathi
content: In Maharashtra, MNS workers aggressively demanded the use of Marathi in banks. They confronted a bank manager in Ambarnath who was not conversing in Marathi, threatened him, and vandalized a computer. The workers demanded that he learn Marathi quickly. This follows MNS Chief Raj Thackeray's recent call to make Marathi mandatory for official communication.

title: Cheetahs get the blame for leopard attacks near Kuno National Park
content: Fear and confusion have gripped villages near Kuno National Park in Madhya Pradesh after recent wild animal attacks. While villagers suspect cheetahs, wildlife officials assert leopards are to blame. The tension peaked when villagers attacked a family of cheetahs.

title: Madhya Pradesh man installs hidden cameras, catches wife assaulting him
content: A viral video shows Lavkesh Manjhi being assaulted by his wife in Satna. Police have filed charges against his wife, mother-in-law, and brother-in-law, who were arrested but later released. An investigation is underway, with a court hearing scheduled for April 7.

title: SRH star reveals what he wants to have from Dhoni, Kohli, and Rohit
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad's Nitish Kumar Reddy shares his admiration for MS Dhoni's captaincy, Virat Kohli's aggression, and Rohit Sharma's pull shot. Reddy, eager for IPL face-offs, looks forward to challenging Jasprit Bumrah post his recovery. Acknowledging the impact of cricket legends, he aspires to continue their legacy in Indian cricket, beginning with their match against Mumbai Indians on April 17.

content: Mike Clay reveals his fantasy football rookie rankings at each key offensive position . the 2025 rankings do not include rookies, since we are unsure of their landing spot . he has finished in the top 12 in fantasy PPG in all four of his seasons .

title: Inside one prospect's 'storybook' journey from Egypt to the NFL draft
content: AHMED HASSANEIN 'S JOURNEY to the doorstep of the NFL began on a balcony seven years ago in Cairo . his sisters, brother and nephew, Gigi and Aziza Ibrahim, told Hassanein's older brother, Cory Besch, about his life over the past decade after moving from California at age 6 . he had forgotten how to speak English, had behavioral issues that caused him to be expelled from school .

title: Think like an expert: Stephania Bell breaks down how to look at baseball injuries
content: Stephania Bell and Tristan H. Cockcroft share insights on injuries . the 2025 fantasy baseball season is here! join or start a brand-new tradition . if you're a fantasy baseball manager or just a fan of a player or team, here's how to think about injury .

title: Harry Kane is on a mission to finally end his long personal trophy drought
content: despite winning trophies and featuring in five finals, Harry Kane has never won a major club trophy . the 33-time german league champion has never tasted victory in a competition . he says he is a man on a mission to win silverware of note . his first year with Bayern Munich ended trophy-less, an unusual feat .

title: 2025 rankings: Profiles for the top 30 TEs

title: USWNT big board: How the 2027 World Cup team is taking shape
content: u.s. women's national team head coach Emma Hayes succinctly summarizes the concept of our USWNT big board . "the position I'm in is: I can only coach what's in front of me," she said last week . if the 2027 Women's World Cup started today, she would need to navigate the tournament without several injured or otherwise unavailable players .

title: Will torpedo bats change the game?
content: the new york Yankees hit a franchise-record nine home runs on march 29 . they became the first team in MLB history to homer on the first three pitches they saw . 13 different hitters have been reported to be regularly using these new bats .

title: 'Everybody has to run their own race': Will Thibs' strategy doom the minutes-heavy Knicks?
content: the Minnesota Timberwolves set a modern NBA record by blowing 22 double-digit leads . coach and team president Tom Thibodeau was crystal clear in diagnosing the issue . despite a slew of teams leaning into the league's load-management strategy, the Wolves did the opposite .

title: Ranking the 15 best players: From Bueckers and Betts to Paopao and Strong
content: the top 15 players in women's college basketball will compete in the final four . "nBA Today" has ranked the top players in men's basketball throughout the season . it's time to see the very best on the biggest stage . the WNBA draft pick is in her fourth final Four .

title: Power Rankings: Who are the top teams one week into the season?
content: the Dodgers and Padres are undefeated, while a team with lofty expectations in the Braves are winless to start the season . we've seen both great individual performances -- Aaron Judge ' walk-off three-run blast' and not so great ones -- Rafael Devers' historic strikeout streak .
